title: Complementary fonts for a Science Fiction/Western novel
content:
I’m looking for fonts to go with the project mentioned in [this thread](http://web.archive.org/web/20150421204433/http:/typophile.com/node/40250): a [_Firefly_](http://web.archive.org/web/20150421204433/http:/en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Firefly_(TV_series))-related book. The two genres for the book are science fiction and Western, and I’m wondering if there are fonts with a ‘feel’ in both directions.  
 Don’t need old-style figures, but I do need book and titling weights, an italic suitable for long runs of text, and a complementary alternate form—a matching sans-serif, perhaps, or at least with a similar x-height and color, but readily distinguishable from the main text. I can fake small capitals if need be. The Gentium Book/Fontin combo I've tried [here](http://web.archive.org/web/20150421204433/http:/typophile.com/files/Hanging%20Chinese.pdf) doesn't work too well.

 Also, is the Chinese font I’ve used (MS MingLiU) the best choice, or can someone recommend a better Chinese titling font/weight? (I.e., a more calligraphic font, still in Song style.)  
—Joel
author: JCSalomon

comments.content:
I've always liked Western & Sci-Fi fonts, but trying to find both was certainly a challenge! I don't know if it's too late, but here are some ideas.  
Some sans-serif faces:  
 [MVB Solano Gothic](http://web.archive.org/web/20150421204433/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/mvbfonts/solano-gothic/bold)  
 [Social Gothic](http://web.archive.org/web/20150421204433/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/canadatype/social-gothic)  
And some slab-serif:  
 [Dispatch from Font Bureau](http://web.archive.org/web/20150421204433/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/fontbureau/dispatch)  
 [Anubis by DSType](http://web.archive.org/web/20150421204433/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/dstype/anubis)  
 [BF Corpa Serif](http://web.archive.org/web/20150421204433/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/brassfonts/corpa-serif) (or Gothic)  
 [LTC Squareface](http://web.archive.org/web/20150421204433/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/lanston/ltc-square-face)

Of those you've mentioned, only [Dispatch](http://web.archive.org/web/20150421204433/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/fontbureau/dispatch/) is much of a text font, and it doesn't have an italic form.  
 I'll probably try for something "standard" like Jenson along with some suitable sans-serif. But the new semester is well underway, and I'm behind on thesis work, so the book project is on the back burner for the nonce.  
—Joel
